Du kannst darÃ¼ber hinaus an Geldautomaten weltweit gebÃ¼hrenfrei Bargeld in jeder WÃ¤hrung abheben.Partnerangebote (neuen Tab): Profitiere von Premium-Partnerangeboten und Rabatten von renommierten MarkenVersicherungspaket von Allianz Global Assistance*: Versicherung, die eine breite Palette an persÃ¶nlichen und finanziellen Leistungen umfasst, wie z. B.:Reiseversicherung: RÃ¼ckerstattung medizinischer Kosten im Ausland, fÃ¼r Reiseannullierungen nach einem medizinischen Notfall, Kosten, die bei einer FlugverspÃ¤tung von mehr als 4 Stunden entstehen, Kosten bei einer VerspÃ¤tung des aufgegebenen GepÃ¤cks von mehr als 6 Stunden und Kosten fÃ¼r medizinische RÃ¼cktransporte.Schnee- und Bergrettung: Du erhÃ¤ltst eine Versicherung fÃ¼r Such- und RettungsmaÃŸnahmen, erste Transportkosten und medizinische Kosten bei UnfÃ¤llen wÃ¤hrend einer Bergtour.Car-, Bike- und Scooter-Sharing: Versicherungsschutz fÃ¼r SchÃ¤den oder Diebstahl von Fahrzeugen, die bei einem entsprechenden Sharing-Unternehmen gemietet wurden.Du kannst N26 Metal mit unseren anderen Konten vergleichen (neuen Tab), um zu sehen, welches am besten zu dir passt!Denke an Folgendes, wenn du dich fÃ¼r N26 Metal (neuen Tab)interessierst:Wenn du Neukunde bist, wird die erste GebÃ¼hr 15 Tage nach deiner IdentitÃ¤tsprÃ¼fung berechnet. Danach wird dir deine monatliche GebÃ¼hr ausgehend von deinem Anmeldedatum berechnet.Bitte Ã¼berweise nach deiner Verifizierung genug Guthaben auf dein Konto, damit die erste monatliche GebÃ¼hr abgedeckt ist, um deine Metal Karte zu erhalten.Wenn du vorher N26 You Mitglied warst, bleiben alle EinkÃ¤ufe und Reisen versichert, die du mit deiner N26 You Mastercard bezahlt hast.Ab sofort steht es dir frei, ob du deine PremiumgebÃ¼hr monatlich oder im Voraus fÃ¼r die nÃ¤chsten 6 Monate oder fÃ¼r 1 Jahr im Rahmen der Vertragslaufzeit bezahlst. Wenn du dich fÃ¼r die Prepaid-Option entscheidest, profitierst du von einem Rabatt auf die monatlichen Kosten deines Premiumkontos (Smart / You / Metal), der anteilig fÃ¼r den von dir gewÃ¼nschten Abrechnungszeitraum gilt.Nach der Anmeldung kannst du die Abrechnungsoptionen (monatlich, halbjÃ¤hrlich oder jÃ¤hrlich) und die damit verbundenen Kosten in deiner N26 App einsehen.*Allianz Global Assistance Europe ist der Markenname von AWP P&C S.A. - Zweigniederlassung Niederlande und gehÃ¶rt zur Allianz Group.

title: Ingresa mediante tarjeta, Apple Pay y Google Pay
content: Ahora puedes ingresar dinero utilizando una tarjeta de dÃ©bito o crÃ©dito, asÃ­ como Apple o Google Pay. Esta es la forma mÃ¡s rÃ¡pida y fÃ¡cil de ingresar dinero en tu cuenta N26.Para ingresar dinero con una tarjeta de dÃ©bito o crÃ©dito:Abre tu app N26 y ve a la pestaÃ±a de Â«TarjetasÂ»Pulsa en Â«Recibir dineroÂ» y selecciona Â«Tarjeta de dÃ©bitoÂ»Elige una cantidad y rellena con los datos de la tarjeta como nombre, nÃºmero, fecha de vencimiento y CVC (no almacenamos la informaciÃ³n de la tarjeta)Sigue los pasos para confirmar el pago.El dinero estarÃ¡ disponible en tu cuenta al instanteLa cantidad que puedes pasar a tu cuenta debe estar comprendida entre un mÃ­nimo de 20 â‚¬ y un mÃ¡ximo de 450 â‚¬ por cada transacciÃ³n recurrente (pestaÃ±a nueva), hasta un mÃ¡ximo de 450 â‚¬ al mes.Para ingresar dinero mediante Google y Apple Pay:Abre tu app de N26 y ve a la pestaÃ±a deÂ  Â«TarjetasÂ»Simplemente pulsa â€œRecibir dineroâ€ y selecciona â€œApple Payâ€ o â€œGoogle Payâ€Elige una cantidadSigue los pasos para confirmar el pago.El dinero estarÃ¡ disponible en tu cuenta al instanteTarjetas aceptadas: las tarjetas Visa y Mastercard que tengan 16 dÃ­gitos de nÃºmero de tarjeta. No se aceptan tarjetas de prepago (por ejemplo, marca A, marca B, etc.). Para obtener mÃ¡s informaciÃ³n sobre la diferencia entre tarjetas de dÃ©bito, crÃ©dito y prepago, lee este artÃ­culo (pestaÃ±a nueva) (inglÃ©s).Coste:Aunque esta es la forma mÃ¡s rÃ¡pida y fÃ¡cil de ingresar dinero en tu cuenta N26, para nosotros, procesar este tipo de transacciones tiene un coste mayor que los mÃ©todos de ingreso que ya ofrecemos.Â Para ambos mÃ©todos, el primer ingreso es siempre gratuito,Â  para los ingresosÂ  adicionales seÂ  cobra una comisiÃ³n del 3% de la cantidad ingresada. Al utilizar estos mÃ©todos,Â  mediante tarjeta o plataforma digital de pago, tu dinero no se envÃ­a al instante a N26, por lo que la comisiÃ³n cubre los costes reales asociados al servicio de ingreso automÃ¡tico ofrecido por N26.

title: Wie melde ich einen Versicherungsfall?
content: DeineÂ N26 You (neuen Tab)- undÂ N26 Metal (neuen Tab)-Mitgliedschaft umfasst eine Vielzahl von Versicherungsleistungen, die von unserem Partner Allianz Global Assistance Europe abgedeckt werden.*Um einen Versicherungsfall zu melden, logge dich in deine App ein, gehe zu ğŸ‘¤ Mein Konto > Deine Mitgliedschaft > Allianz Versicherung.Dort findest du:Einen Leitfaden, wie du einen Versicherungsfall einreichen kannst (z. B. Flug- oder GepÃ¤ckverspÃ¤tung, Handydiebstahl, GarantieverlÃ¤ngerung oder Reisestornierung)Deine N26 Kontoinformationen, sowie die Nummer deiner Allianz Versicherungspolice Die MÃ¶glichkeit, dich bei einem medizinischen Notfall direkt an die Allianz zu wendenHalte im Notfall bitte folgende Informationen bereit:Die vollstÃ¤ndige Adresse und Telefonnummer deines aktuellen AufenthaltsortesNamen aller offiziellen Ansprechpartner (Ã„rzte, KrankenhÃ¤user und/oder Polizei)Eine genaue Beschreibung der Situation*Allianz Global Assistance Europe ist ein Markenname von AWP P&C S.A. - Zweigniederlassung Niederlande und gehÃ¶rt zur Allianz Group.

title: Â¿QuÃ© son las transferencias inmediatas?
content: Ahora, todos los clientes y clientas de N26 pueden enviar transferencias inmediatas. A diferencia de las transferencias SEPA ordinarias, que se tramitan en un plazo de dos dÃ­as laborables, las transferencias inmediatas se envÃ­an y reciben en cuestiÃ³n de segundos.Las transferencias inmediatas pueden resultarte Ãºtiles si necesitas enviar una transferencia urgente (tarda unos 10 segundos), pero los clientes y clientas del plan EstÃ¡ndar pagan una comisiÃ³n por la transferencia inmediata, que se muestra antes de confirmarla. Por tanto, si puedes esperar hasta 2 dÃ­as a que llegue el dinero, te recomendamos una transferencia SEPA ordinaria. Nuestros clientes y clientas premium pueden enviar una inmediata sin comisiones.Si bien es inmediata, este tipo de transferencia puede sufrir retrasos debido a la tramitaciÃ³n, embargos, etc. (al igual que las transferencias ordinarias), asÃ­ que si tienes que hacer un pago importante (p. ej., fianzas, entradas), te aconsejamos que no esperes al Ãºltimo momento para evitar pÃ©rdidas financieras debido a los retrasos.Â¿CÃ³mo funciona?Si quieres enviar una transferencia inmediata, inicia sesiÃ³n en la app del mÃ³vil y selecciona Enviar dinero > Transferencia bancaria.A continuaciÃ³n, se te pedirÃ¡ que introduzcas el nombre y el IBAN del beneficiario/a, aÃ±adas un mensaje y confirmes la transacciÃ³n.Selecciona Transferencia inmediataLa transferencia se tramitarÃ¡ y recibirÃ¡ aproximadamente en 10 segundos.Nota: si el banco del beneficiario/a no forma parte del programa de transferencias inmediatas, no tendrÃ¡s la opciÃ³n de enviarla.InformaciÃ³n importante:Los clientes y clientas de N26 EstÃ¡ndar pagan una comisiÃ³n por las transferencias inmediatas. La comisiÃ³n se cobra justo despuÃ©s como transacciÃ³n independiente y varÃ­a dependiendo del paÃ­s:Alemania y Austria: 0,49 â‚¬EspaÃ±a: 1,99 â‚¬Italia, Francia y el resto de Europa: 0,99 â‚¬El importe mÃ¡ximo que puedes enviar con una transferencia inmediata es de 2.000 â‚¬, 5 veces al dÃ­a por un mÃ¡ximo diario de 10.000 â‚¬.Si utilizas la transferencia inmediata para un pago importante (fianzas, multas, entradas), te aconsejamos que no esperes al Ãºltimo momento para evitar retrasos debido a un posible rechazo o embargo.Si pagas un producto o servicio mediante una transferencia inmediata, recuerda comprobar los datos y las credenciales del beneficiario/a antes de confirmar la transacciÃ³n. Hay que estar siempre al tanto de posibles timos.Nota: No todos los bancos participan en el programa de transferencias inmediatas. Si el banco beneficiario no participa en el programa, no tendrÃ¡s la opciÃ³n de enviar la transferencia inmediata.

title: How to protect my identity?
content: To protect and help avoid the misuse of your personal data, please keep in mind that:We will never ask you to prove your identity on behalf of other individuals or companies. This includes verifications for apartment rental contracts, lines of credit, or job offers (including jobs with N26). Only complete the verification process if you want to open an N26 bank account for yourself.As the account owner, only you should create and have access to your login details. Never create an N26 bank account with a predefined email address and password. If you use login credentials that were given to you, these credentials may be used to reach your personal and legal information. Also, never log into an N26 account that is not yours.Do not send your ID or passport to unknown or unverified recipients.We may ask for certain documents when your transaction is subject to a routine check. Only send valid documentation to verified N26 email accounts.We will never ask for your username, password, or PIN codes outside the N26 app. Never provide this information in an external website or app, even if it looks N26-related.If you ever feel in doubt, have received a suspicious request from a third party, or think your N26 login may be compromised, please do not hesitate to contact us.

title: What is a security footer, and why have we included one?
content: A security footer is a personalised message added to the bottom of emails and digital documents, the purpose of which is to act as a seal of authenticity.By adding your full name at the bottom of each email, our aim is to help you to differentiate between legitimate emails sent by N26 and phishing emails sent by fraudsters.Â Although a security footer cannot definitively prove an email has originated from a verified source, it aids in mitigating the risk of deceptive-phishing - the most common type of phishing attack.What is deceptive-phishing?Deceptive-phishing is the illegal practice of sending generic phishing emails to large quantities of unknown individuals, the objective behind which is to obtain privileged information under false pretences.How is this achieved?Â Fraudsters contact their targets under the guise of working for well-known companies. Targets are then lured into a false sense of security with brand imagery, time-sensitive scenarios, and misleading language. Once hooked, fraudsters will attempt to manipulate their targets into complying with their demands.How can you protect yourself?Pay close attention to emails you receive from banks, clients, employers, and so on. If youâ€™re asked to do something, never act on impulse; always think carefully before taking action.Â If you have a feeling that something is off, donâ€™t ignore it. Take notice of incorrect spelling and grammar, hover over (donâ€™t click) hidden URLs, check sender details, and do some research - a quick online check can help you to verify a senderâ€™s identity.If youâ€™ve received a suspicious email, phone call and/or SMS, in the name of N26, forward your concerns to our Customer Support team at support@n26.com. If youâ€™d like to discuss account-related issues, chat to us via our mobile app.Learn more about:How to report suspected phishing attacks (new tab)How to recognize and avoid phishing attacks (new tab)How to protect yourself from social engineering (new tab)

title: Wie benutze ich meine Karte digital?
content: Schon bevor dich deine Karte mit der Post erreicht, kannst du beginnen, sie durch Apple Pay oder Google Pay zu benutzen. Auf diese Weise kannst du mit deinem Handy bei Anbietern bezahlen, die diese Zahlungsmethode unterstÃ¼tzen:Logge dich in dein N26 Konto ein.Gehe zu Karten.Tippe auf Karteneinstellungen und wÃ¤hle aus der Liste deiner Karten diejenige Karte aus, auf die du wartest.Tippe auf Zu Google Wallet hinzufÃ¼gen bzw. Zu Apple Pay hinzufÃ¼gen.Wie kann ich meine Karteninformationen in der N26 App sehen?Wenn du deine Karteninformationen benÃ¶tigst, aber deine N26 Karte momentan nicht dabei hast, kein Problem! N26 ermÃ¶glicht dir, deine kompletten Karteninformationen in der mobilen N26 App einzusehen, sofern deine Karte aktiviert und dein Handy verknÃ¼pft ist. Es ist ganz einfach:Logge dich in die mobile N26 App ein.Tippe im Homescreen auf Karten.WÃ¤hle aus der Liste deiner Karte diejenige Karte aus, die du sehen willst.Tippe auf Karteninformationen.BestÃ¤tige mit deinem Fingerabdruck, deiner Face-ID oder deiner Handy-PIN.Deine kompletten Karteninformationen kannst du jetzt fÃ¼r 1 Minute sehen. Bitte beachte, dass du wÃ¤hrenddessen keine Screenshots machen kannst.

title: How to order my Maestro card?
content: Only applies to Germany, Austria and the NetherlandsYou need our German, Austrian or Dutch Terms & Conditions to order aÂ Maestro (new tab) card. Just login to your account and go to:Cards Tap: Get an additional Card Then tap: Maestro Then tap Choose to order the card The Maestro card is free of charge only for N26 Smart, N26 You and N26 Metal customers, while it costs 10â‚¬ for N26 Standard customers. Maestro is a widely adopted payment system which allows you to make payments using a Maestro card in stores. All our Mastercards as well as our Maestro cards are debit cards.For more information about the delivery timeline please go to our dedicated article.

title: How to change my confirmation PIN?
content: Step by Step Instructions:iPhoneAndroidStep 1Open your N26 app, tap the My Account icon on the top right of your screenStep 2Scroll down and tap on SecurityStep 3Choose Change confirmation PINStep 4Enter your card token: the 10-digit number on the front or back of your card.Step 5Create and confirm your new confirmation PINStep 1Open your N26 app, tap the My Account icon on the top right of your screenStep 2Scroll down and tap on SecurityStep 3Choose Change confirmation PINStep 4Enter your card token: the 10-digit number on the front or back of your card.Step 5Create and confirm your new confirmation PINThe confirmation PIN is the code you use to confirm transfers or any other transactions you make from your N26 app. If you arenâ€™t sure what it is, remember that you created your own confirmation PIN when you paired your smartphone (new tab) with your account for the first time.If youâ€™ve forgotten your PIN code or want to change it, you can do so at any time. Simply follow these steps:Open your N26 app, go to ğŸ‘¤ My Account, then Settings, and then tap Security or click Choose Change confirmation PINEnter your card token, the 10-digit number that appears below your name on the front of your card (for N26 Smart, You, and Metal cards, the number appears on the back)Create and confirm your new confirmation PINIf you enter your Confirmation PIN incorrectly 6 times in a row, you'll have to reset it before trying again.For security reasons we donâ€™t accept any PIN containing elements of your birth date, address, or any combination of repeated digits or numerical sequences, such as 1111, 1234 or 4321. If the number you chose fails, please try again with a different combination.Remember that your confirmation PIN is not the same as your debit card PIN, (new tab) although you can certainly choose the same PIN code for both if you wish.

title: Why didn't I receive my pairing code via SMS?
content: For iOS customers who are not receiving our Pairing SMS, you may have a feature enabled that filters our SMS. To find our message in iMessage, go to the Filters option in the top left and select the Unknown senders folder.A pairing code is required toÂ connect your smartphoneÂ to your account. If you didnâ€™t receive this code via SMS for whatever reason, you can request a new one up to five times in the mobile app. Please wait 30 seconds before requesting a new one. If all five codes are requested and pairing is still unsuccessful, then for security reasons youâ€™ll be blocked from making further requests for 24 hours. If this happens, you can either wait or contact our Customer Support via chat - who would be happy to help you.If your country code is outside of the EU, itâ€™s likely that youâ€™ll need to contact us to receive a pairing code.

title: Wie kann ich meine BestÃ¤tigungs-PIN Ã¤ndern?
content: Schritt-fÃ¼r-Schritt Anleitung:iPhoneAndroidSchritt 1Ã–ffne die N26 App und tippe oben rechts auf Mein Konto Schritt 2Scrolle herunter und tippe auf SicherheitSchritt 3Tippe auf Ã„ndere deinen BestÃ¤tigungscodeSchritt 4Gib deine Tokennummer ein: die 10-stellige Nummer auf der RÃ¼ckseite deiner KarteSchritt 5Erstelle und bestÃ¤tige deine neue BestÃ¤tigungs-PINSchritt 1Ã–ffne die N26 App und tippe oben rechts auf Mein Konto Schritt 2Scrolle herunter und tippe auf SicherheitSchritt 3Tippe auf Ã„ndere deinen BestÃ¤tigungscodeSchritt 4Gib deine Tokennummer ein: die 10-stellige Nummer auf der RÃ¼ckseite deiner KarteSchritt 5Erstelle und bestÃ¤tige deine neue BestÃ¤tigungs-PINMit der BestÃ¤tigungs-PIN bestÃ¤tigst du Ãœberweisungen und andere Transaktionen, die du in der App tÃ¤tigst. Bei der VerknÃ¼pfung deines Smartphones (neuen Tab) mit deinem Konto legst du die BestÃ¤tigungs-PIN selbst fest. title: Chargebacks and card transaction disputes FAQ
content:
In the event of an unauthorized transaction or even eligible authorized transactions, N26 customers can dispute a payment made with their N26 debit Mastercard and get their money back. Read on for answers to our frequently asked questions on chargebacks, and learn how to dispute a transaction (new tab) in this step-by-step article.Iâ€™ve noticed an unauthorized transaction on my account. What should I do?If youâ€™ve noticed an unauthorized transaction on your account, youâ€™ll need to order a new card in order to keep your account secure and prevent further unauthorized transactions from occurring. Go to your N26 app, and re-order your card in the â€˜Cardsâ€™ tab. You can mark the reason as â€œlostâ€ or â€œstolenâ€ based on your situation. If your card was in your possession at all times, youâ€™ll need to re-confirm that you did not make the transaction yourself. Then, if necessary, report the fraud to the police, and follow the instructions to initiate a payment dispute (new tab).Â Â How do I file a dispute for goods I ordered online?The process for filing a dispute for goods ordered online depends on the circumstance. Hereâ€™s a breakdown of the most common scenarios:You ordered goods online but never received them, and the merchant provided an expected delivery date
First, youâ€™ll need to wait until the estimated delivery date has passed. If the goods donâ€™t arrive within this timeframe, you can dispute the transaction from the date you expected to receive the goods. Mastercardâ€™s chargeback guidelines state that you must file the dispute within 120 days of the anticipated delivery date.You ordered goods online but never received them, and you were never provided with an expected delivery dateÂ 
In this scenario, Mastercardâ€™s chargeback guidelines allow you to file a dispute 30 days after the transaction date, kicking off a 120-day window in which the filing must take place.Â You received a delivery, but it doesnâ€™t correspond with what you orderedÂ 
Here, you may file the dispute right away, provided you aren't able to resolve the issue with the merchant. You have 120 days from the date you received the goods.I tried to withdraw cash at an ATM. I was charged, but I didnâ€™t receive the cash. What should I do?First, try contacting the bank that owns the ATM. This is the fastest way to get your money back. Hereâ€™s some guidance on what to say:Dear XX,Â I attempted to withdraw cash from an ATM owned by your bank. I did not receive the cash, but was still charged. Below, you can find information about the transaction:Â Amount: â‚¬{insert amount}ATM name: {insert ATM/bank name} ATMDate and time of transaction: DD/MM/YYYY at {insert time} (CET)ATM location: {ATM address - include the name of the street, or shopping mall}Please return the funds to my account, or I will be forced to file a chargeback with my bank.Â If the bank that owns the ATM is not helpful, follow the instructions to initiate a dispute (new tab). Be sure to include the transaction date, amount, and merchant, as well as your reason for contesting this transaction.I have a previously authorized payment with a merchant who has charged me again without my authorization. What should I do?First, reach out to the merchant to see if they can helpâ€“â€“this is the fastest way to get your money back. Hereâ€™s a basic template you can use to raise this issue with them:Â Dear XX,Â I authorized a transaction to {merchant name}, but {merchant name} has issued an additional charge without my authorization. Please find information about the transactions below:Â Merchant name: {insert merchant name}Â Amount of original, authorized transaction: â‚¬{insert amount}Amount of non-authorized transaction: â‚¬{insert amount}Date & time of original, authorized transaction: DD/MM/YYYY at {insert time} (CET)Date & time of non-authorized transaction: DD/MM/YYYY at {insert time} (CET)Please return the funds to my account, or I will be forced to file a chargeback with my bank and initiate a complaint to the police/authorities.If the merchant is unresponsive or uncooperative, you can follow the instructions here to initiate a chargeback with N26. Be sure to include the transaction date, amount, merchant name, and the reason for contesting the transaction so that we have all the information we need to move your case forward.Â The merchant told me that theyâ€™ve issued a refund to my N26 card, but I never received the refund. What should I do?Refunds can take up to 15 calendar days from the date they were issued by the merchant. If 15 days have passed and you still havenâ€™t received your refund, simply follow the instructions to initiate a dispute (new tab). Please include the transaction date, amount, merchant and your reason for contesting this transaction.Â How does N26 prevent fraud?At N26, protecting your account is our top priority. Thatâ€™s why we offer a variety of features to keep your money safe, including the option to block your card in seconds, activate or deactivate payments abroad, enable or disable online transactions, and set spending limitsâ€“â€“all right from your N26 app. We also offer biometric authentication for a secure login, 3D Secure technology for safe online payments, and a â€˜Discreet Mode (new tab)â€™ option to securely access your account in public.Â Instant push-notifications help you stay up-to-date on all your incoming and outgoing payments, so youâ€™re always aware of whatâ€™s happening on your account. Plus, weâ€™re always improving our internal processes and tools to detect and prevent card fraud.Â How does card fraud occur?Â A: When it comes to debit cards or credit cards, there are 3 main ways in which fraud occurs:Your card is skimmed and counterfeited. This may happen when you use your card at an ATM thatâ€™s been tampered with in order to steal card details.Your card details are stolen online. This may happen if:Â You ordered something from a fraudulent websiteYour details are stolen while making a legitimate purchaseÂ Your online shopping account is hackedÂ Your physical card is stolen and used to make purchases.How can I protect my account from fraud?Â Here are a few ways you can protect your account from fraud:Only use ATMs that belong to trusted banksÂ Only place orders with trusted online retailers and websitesChange your online passwords and PINs regularlyÂ Never trust text messages or emails that appear to come from N26 which ask you to provide your card details, account details, or include suspicious links. N26 will never ask for your card or account details outside of the N26 app or the N26 WebApp.Change your card settings within your N26 app. For example, disable online payments, ATM withdrawals, payments abroad, and set spending limits that correspond with your regular spending behavior.Avoid making Magnetic Stripe transactions if possible. Instead, opt for the safer NFC chip-based or digital wallet transactions where available.Always keep your card in a safe place.

title: PSD2 - Secure Open Banking
content:
What is PSD2?Payment Services Directive 2 (â€œPSD2â€) is a revised European directive allowing you to access your account information and initiate payments through regulated third-party providers in a safe and secure manner. 
 
This means that you can permit regulated Third Party Providers to access your account information through a dedicated interface: You can enable an Account Information Service (AIS) to pull together data from different bank accounts you may have, and then aggregate and manage their details in the same place through certified third-party providers.You can securely pay at the checkout of any website that offers Payment Initiation Services (PIS). The data exchange is handled in the background via our partner - Token.io.How does it work?If you begin using a third-party payment service like an Account Information Service or a Payment Initiation Service, youâ€™ll be redirected to your N26 app via Token.io to confirm the access request.In our Privacy Policy (new tab) we inform you about the purposes, involved parties and legal bases of the necessary data processing involved to fulfil our obligations as part of the revised European Payment Services Directive.FAQsWhy can't I link any Third Party Provider to my account?If a third party provider has not integrated with our dedicated interface, the third party provider will need to integrate with our dedicated interface via our partner Token.io.How can I revoke an individual access permission I have granted to a third party provider?You need to contact the respective Third Party Provider and revoke the access permission directly with them.Â *applies to all countries in the EEA.

title: Come cambiare il mio PIN di conferma?
content: Istruzioni passo per passo:iPhoneAndroidPasso 1Accedi alla tua app N26 e vai a Il mio conto, nell'angolo in altro a destraPasso 2Scorri in basso e seleziona SicurezzaPasso 3Vai su Cambia PIN di ConfermaPasso 4Inserisci il token della tua carta: il numero di 10 cifre presente sulla tua cartaPasso 5Crea e salva il tuo PIN di ConfermaPasso 1Accedi alla tua app N26 e vai a Il mio conto, nell'angolo in altro a destraPasso 2Scorri in basso e seleziona SicurezzaPasso 3Vai su Cambia PIN di ConfermaPasso 4Inserisci il token della tua carta: il numero di 10 cifre presente sulla tua cartaPasso 5Crea e salva il tuo PIN di ConfermaIl PIN di conferma Ã¨ quello che usi per confermare i bonifici o qualsiasi altra operazione che esegui dall'app. Se non sai quale sia, il tuo PIN di conferma Ã¨ quello che crei quando associ il tuo smartphone (nuova tabella) per la prima volta.Se l'hai dimenticato o lo vuoi cambiare, puoi farlo quando vuoi tramite l'app:Accedi a ğŸ‘¤ Il mio conto, poi Sicurezza.Seleziona Cambiare il PIN di conferma.Inserisci il token della tua carta (si tratta di un numero di 10 cifre che appare sotto il tuo nome sul fronte della tua carta; o sul retro, sulle carte N26 Smart, You e Metal).Crea e conferma il tuo nuovo PIN di conferma.Se inserisci il PIN di conferma in modo errato per 6 volte di seguito, dovrai ripristinarlo prima di riprovare.Per ragioni di sicurezza, non accettiamo PIN che contengano elementi della tua data di nascita, indirizzo o altre combinazioni con cifre ripetute o sequenze numeriche (come 1111, 1234 o 4321). Se il numero scelto non Ã¨ valido, ti preghiamo di riprovare con una combinazione diversa.Ricorda che il tuo PIN di conferma non Ã¨ lo stesso del codice PIN della tua carta, (nuova tabella) ma se vuoi puoi scegliere lo stesso PIN per entrambi.

title: Wie kann ich meine Karte sperren?
content: Du kannst deine Karten jederzeit in der App sperren und entsperren. Tippe bzw. klicke im Homescreen auf Karten wÃ¤hle dann Karteneinstellungen aus. Dort kannst du entscheiden, ob du deine Abhebungen am Geldautomaten, Online- und Auslandszahlungen vorÃ¼bergehend einschrÃ¤nken, deaktivieren oder deine Karte komplett sperren mÃ¶chtest. So hast du die volle Kontrolle Ã¼ber deine Karte und kannst dich vor unberechtigten Transaktionen schÃ¼tzen. Du solltest deine Karte sofort sperren, wenn dir etwas verdÃ¤chtig vorkommt. Du kannst sie spÃ¤ter jederzeit wieder entsperren. Falls du keinen Zugriff auf deine N26 Smartphone-App oder die WebApp hast, kannst du deine Karte oder dein Konto auch sperren, indem du uns unter +49 (0) 307 675 8333 anrufst.

content: VerfÃ¼gbar in Deutschland, Ã–sterreich, Frankreich, Spanien, Italien, Belgien, Estland, Finnland, Irland, Litauen, Luxemburg, Niederlande, Portugal, Slowakei, Slowenien, Polen, Schweden, DÃ¤nemark, Norwegen, Island, Liechtenstein.Wenn du bereits ein N26 Standard-Konto hast, oder ein N26 Smart /Â N26 You Mitglied bist, kannst du in der App auf N26 Metal upgraden: Um dich zu upgraden, logge dich einfach in die App ein, tippe auf den "Entdecken" am unteren Bildschirmrand und wÃ¤hle dann "Entdecke N26 Metal".Â Du kannst zwischen einer Karte in Quarzrosa, Platingrau oder Carbonschwarz wÃ¤hlen.Nachdem du deine bevorzugteÂ VersandmethodeÂ und die Farbe (Quarzrosa, Platingrau oder Carbonschwarz) ausgewÃ¤hlt hast, musst du nur noch die N26 MetalÂ AGB (neuen Tab)Â akzeptieren und den Auftrag mit deinerÂ BestÃ¤tigungs-PINÂ abschlieÃŸen. Schon ist deine Karte auf dem Weg!Standardlieferungen dauern bis zu 15 Werktage.Der Mitgliedsbeitrag von 16,90 â‚¬ wird jeden Monat von deinem Konto abgebucht, gezÃ¤hlt ab dem Tag deines Upgrades.Alle KÃ¤ufe und Reisen, die du mit deiner N26 You Mastercard bezahlt hast, bleiben versichert.Wenn du bereits N26 You Mitglied bist, musst du die You-GebÃ¼hren nicht zusÃ¤tzlich zahlen.Du kannst eine zusÃ¤tzlich N26 You-Karte fÃ¼r eine einmalige GebÃ¼hr von 10â‚¬ in deiner N26 App bestellen.Du willst deinen Freunden von uns erzÃ¤hlen und gleichzeitig Geld verdienen? content: Lamentamos que actualmente no puedas vincular tu cuenta Wise. title: How to file a complaint?
content:
If you have any questions about our products or need help with your account, weâ€™re happy to assist. Just open a chat with us directly within the mobile app or (new tab)Webapp (new tab) - that's the fastest and simplest way to get in touch.
If you ever feel dissatisfied with one of our products or services, you can also send us an email from your registered email address.You can send an email to: complaints.uk@n26.com.(If you have a registered N26 account from outside of the UK please go here (new tab)).To file a complaint, please include:your full name and addressthe product or service you're not happy witha description of your concernthe date in which the problem first appearedWe'll send you an email confirmation once we've received your complaint and have begun to investigate. Our aim is to find an agreeable solution and respond to your complaint as soon as possible. Some cases can take a bit longer, that's why the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) gives us up to 8 weeks to provide you with our final response. In case we need more information from you or we can provide you with an immediate solution, weâ€™ll let you know via email as well.In case weâ€™re not able to find a solution youâ€™re happy with, you can refer your complaint to the Financial Ombudsman Service (new tab) (FOS).

title: Where is my refund?
content:
In most cases, your refund will be visible in the app on the day of the original transaction, not the refund date. Scroll down your transaction list or download your previous balance statements to find it.To view and download PDFs of your (preliminary and previous) monthly balance statements:On the WebApp (new tab): From Transactions, click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads then select Bank statements.
On the mobile app: If you're using an iPhone, tap on the three dots to the right of your current balance from the main screen. A menu will pop up and will give you the option to access your balance statement.Â For Androids, you'll find the option under Insights (just tap the 3 dots in the top right-hand corner).The amounts blocked as a car rental deposit can take up to 30 days to return to your account while a refund of a card payment will be automatically credited to your account within a maximum of 14 days.

title: How to change my confirmation PIN?
content: Step by Step Instructions:iPhoneAndroidStep 1Open your N26 app, tap the My Account icon on the top right of your screenStep 2Scroll down and tap on SecurityStep 3Choose Change confirmation PINStep 4Enter your card token: the 10-digit number on the front or back of your card.Step 5Create and confirm your new confirmation PINStep 1Open your N26 app, tap the My Account icon on the top right of your screenStep 2Scroll down and tap on SecurityStep 3Choose Change confirmation PINStep 4Enter your card token: the 10-digit number on the front or back of your card.Step 5Create and confirm your new confirmation PINThe confirmation PIN is the code you use to confirm transfers or any other transactions you make from your N26 app. If you arenâ€™t sure what it is, remember that you created your own confirmation PIN when you paired your smartphone (new tab) with your account for the first time.If youâ€™ve forgotten your PIN code or want to change it, you can do so at any time. Simply follow these steps:Open your N26 app, go to ğŸ‘¤ My Account, then Settings, and then tap Security or click Choose Change confirmation PINEnter your card token, the 10-digit number that appears below your name on the front of your card (for N26 Smart, You, and Metal cards, the number appears on the back)Create and confirm your new confirmation PINIf you enter your Confirmation PIN incorrectly 6 times in a row, you'll have to reset it before trying again.For security reasons we donâ€™t accept any PIN containing elements of your birth date, address, or any combination of repeated digits or numerical sequences, such as 1111, 1234 or 4321. If the number you chose fails, please try again with a different combination.Remember that your confirmation PIN is not the same as your debit card PIN, (new tab) although you can certainly choose the same PIN code for both if you wish.

If the number you chose fails, please try again with a different combination.Remember that your confirmation PIN is not the same as your debit card PIN, (new tab) although you can certainly choose the same PIN code for both if you wish.

title: How to request a refund for a direct debit?
content: Refunding a direct debit does not cancel the contract you have with the merchant.You have the ability to request a SEPA direct debit refund in the app yourself up to 8 weeks after it has been debited. The direct debit will be credited to your account within 2 banking days.Requesting a direct debit refund in my main account:Login to the N26 mobile appOpen your transaction list and select the direct debit in questionChooseÂ RefundRequesting direct debit refund in my IBAN Space (subaccount):You can also request a direct debit refund in your IBAN-assigned Spaces:Login to the N26 mobile appTap on SpacesGo to the Space you wish to refund a direct debitSelect the direct debit transaction in questionChoose Refund*For Non-Euro countries only: If you are setting up a direct debit with a merchant in your home currency, it's the receiving bank who dictates the currency exchange and the ultimate amount that is collected from us. This applies to the following countries: Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Hungary, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Poland, Romania, Sweden, Switzerland

title: How to download my personal data?
content: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a European regulation on data protection and privacy that went into effect on May 25th, 2018. Weâ€™ve added a data export option to the WebApp (new tab) as a response to Art. 20 GDPR. And, as with everything we do, getting your personal data you provided to us is transparent and simple, and youâ€™re in complete control: go to ğŸ‘¤ My Account then Personal settings and Your personal data.The right to data portability under Art. 20 GDPR covers personal data you provided to us. Art. 20 GDPR shall enable you to easily switch the service provider in case you want to use these data to open a bank account at another bank. This is why Art. 20 GDPR requires to provide these data in a machine-readable format to you. Â It's important to keep in mind that the file is to be used for data portability purposes only and your computer might not be able to read a JSON file. Also, if you can open the JSON file the data might be difficult to understand as it is not intended to be human-readable, but machine-readable. The file we provide has the only purpose of being transmitted to another bank.Â As a mobile bank, we know the importance of data security. For this reason we take additional security measures before you can download your data, which are described below. We do so in order to make sure that you, the account holder, is in fact the person who downloads the data.Â Â How to download your dataYou can request to download the personal data you provided for a current or previous account. It will come in a machine-readable format so you can share it with a third party if you choose to.Current customers:Please request your data through our web form (new tab).You will be asked to create a temporary password to use for the link we send to your registered email address. This link is only valid for 24 hours from the moment you received the email. And please note that if the password is entered incorrectly five times, the link will become invalid and you will need to create a new export request.Former customers:You can download personal data you provided to us after account closure. To request this information, complete a data request form (new tab) and make sure that the information you provide correctly matches all your previous account information. Youâ€™ll need to know:the first and last name, personal ID number, and expiration date of the identification document (national ID card or passport) you used to verify the account,the registered email address of the account,the date (month and year) you created and closed your account (check your verification email).For security reasons, we have to make sure itâ€™s really you downloading the data: if any field is inaccurate or missing, your request will not be successful.You will be asked to create a temporary password to use for the link we send to your registered email address. This link is only valid for 24 hours from the moment you received the email. And please note that if the password is entered incorrectly five times, the link will become invalid and you will need to create a new export request.If you want more information about the collection, use, and processing of your personal data, please visit our updated Privacy Policy (DEU (new tab)) (EU (new tab)).

title: How to contact N26?
content: If you want to reach our customer service team, you can open a chat with us directly by clicking the Start new Support Chat button at the bottom of this page.Â Chat is available Monday to Sunday from 7am to 10pm UK time.Â Alternatively, you can reach us via email at: support@n26.com (new tab).If you represent a bank or authority, please get in touch through our article I represent a bank or an authority and need to contact N26 .
